title: Guitar Fundamentals
description: A gentle, self-paced 7-day foundation: posture, fretting, rhythm, and consistency.

pages.title: Proper Posture (2 minutes)
pages.content:
Sit tall, relax your shoulders, and keep your wrists neutral. The goal is comfort and repeatability, not “perfect form.”

Keep the neck angled slightly upward. If you feel pain, adjust immediately.

pages.question: Which is the best posture cue?
options: Grip the neck tightly for control
Hunch forward so you can see the strings

pages.prompt: I practiced holding the guitar for 5 minutes

pages.title: Clean sound checklist (3 minutes)
pages.content:
Fret just behind the fret wire (not on top of it). Press with the fingertip, keep the thumb relaxed behind the neck, and use only as much pressure as needed.

Work slowly—clean notes come from precision, not force.

pages.question: Where should your finger land for the cleanest note?
options: In the middle of the fret space

pages.prompt: What string/fret buzzed the most today, and what did you change to fix it?
pages.placeholder: Example: 2nd string at 3rd fret buzzed until I moved closer to the fret and curved my finger.

pages.prompt: I played each string slowly and adjusted until it rang clearly

pages.title: Rhythm first (3 minutes)
pages.content:
Great guitar playing is mostly rhythm. Start by counting steady: 1 & 2 & 3 & 4 &.

Strum lightly and consistently. If timing is solid, everything else improves faster.

pages.question: What should you prioritize first when learning a new strumming pattern?

pages.prompt: I counted 1 & 2 & 3 & 4 & while strumming for 2 minutes
